questions.question: Which of the following statements is not true regarding custom transformers?
options: Custom transformers appear in the Navigator, Transformer Gallery, and Quick Add menu.
Custom transformers can be created from scratch or by incorporating transformers already added to the Canvas.
Custom transformers can have a name and description.
Custom transformers require writing code to create.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best scenario for using a custom transformer?
options: You want to batch process many files with the same workspace.
You want to create a reusable and user-friendly way to query an API not officially supported by any FME formats or transformers.
You want to read a custom coordinate system.
You want to write out your data to multiple tables based on attribute values you don't know in advance.

questions.question: Filling in a Description for your custom transformer is only useful if you plan to upload it to the FME Hub.
If you have multiple instances of a custom transformer in your workspace, editing one will cause changes in the others.
